pros: Career progression and competitive pay for managers. Looks impressive on paper. Not worth it.
cons:
Managing staff here was awful. As a new member to the team I witnessed some truly horrible practice and had incident reports coming out of my ears, but was given no support or tools to fire problem staff. My line manager was a bully and had no self awareness or self reflective skills. I continously had my cpd training days cancelled without telling me despite this being a high needs service needing epilepsy and diabetes training. The service users were mostly miserable and it was a draining place to work. 

I was sexually assaulted by a predatory colleague after a month of escalating sexual harassment. I reported it immediately and was told that it was because of what I was wearing. I was not offered the opportunity to have a union rep in my meeting and it was rushed through while I was in tears. I was then told that we would have to continue working together unless I left the service, which would mean a pay cut and demotion from my position. Ultimately I left because of the depression and anxiety caused by this incident. This experience left me with lasting trauma.

job_title: My Choice Worker in Ealing, England
pros: Flexible hours, you take the shifts you can do and some services allow you to change it slightly depending on requirements. Great network, many connections provided just by working in a service
cons: sometimes there are no shifts available. You do not often work on set shifts (i.e. hours per month can vary greatly and so can shift patterns) as you work based on demand of services. Additionally, there is very little involvement from Head office to make you feel part of certitude team, it is up to individual services to provide inside knowledge etc.

review_title: My manager was great but poorly run
pros: Great ethos about wanting to provide the best service for people with Learning Disability, Autism or Mental Health. You are made to feel welcome and training is good. You meet some lovely people. Great committed people work for Certitude which is being propped up by these committed, loyal souls as most homes are understaffed.
cons:
Certitude do not walk their talk. Directors are entrenched having been there for over 10 years some of them, Head's that need to be dismissed because they are incompetent are still there.  There are things that need to change, but it is difficult because Director's and above do not want to change. I love Certitude's ambition but they need to take care of the fundamental's like truly listening to operational staff's concerns implementing the changes that staff require. They also need to pay operational staff more. People are leaving in droves but this is put down to being normal staff wastage. It is not and they really should have a leavers form so they can take on board the views that leavers have. 
 If they like you and your face fits then they will go so far as create a role for you, if they don't and you have a complaint against your manager then you are left to sink or swim. 
They say they care but these are empty platitudes. For some people Certitude will work and there are staff that have been there for over five and ten years and counting. It's a bit of a caustic environment that is difficult to detect at first because it is similar to Stepford Wives! Everyone seems happy and smiley on the surface but dig deeper and you find something different.
